DOC.brief_summary: Random grouping by computer, divided into two groups, a group of rhubarb treatment group, another group for the placebo group.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Rhubarb on Sepsis and Post-traumatic Gastrointestinal Function Failure
DOC.detailed_description: Patients were randomly divided into two groups, using rhubarb powder or placebo. Rhubarb is commercially certified rhubarb(Rheum palmatum, Sichuan origin, provided by the pharmacy of my hospital), ground into a powder, over 80 mesh steel mesh, Two days before 6g, three times / day, oral or nasal feeding, two days later reduced to 3g, three times / day, oral or nasal feeding; Another group of patients taking placebo, with the same dose of Rhubarb; The overall course of the two drugs was a week.
DOC.criteria: 1. Age:1865 year old; 2. Diagnosis: sepsis with gastrointestinal dysfunction (IIIII grade AGI); gastrointestinal dysfunction after trauma (IIIII AGI); 3. Complete gastrointestinal tract anatomic structure（including the ileum and colon stoma） 1. Hemodynamic instability; 2. Underlying diseases: cardiac function III~IV, chronic liver dysfunction ChildPugh score >9 points; 3. Less than 5 days after surgery for stomach and small intestine，less than 7 days after Colonic surgery, Postoperative gastrointestinal leakage; 4. Abdominal Compartment Syndrome; 5. mechanical ileus 6. active gastrointestinal hemorrhage
